pageContext.claim: “I am actually a very popular president, which people don’t like to say, you know. In fact, I guess the Republican poll came out, there’s one at 92 and one at 93 and one at 90, and they’re the highest numbers that have ever been, with the exception of a tiny period of time with a bullhorn. But that period lasted for about a week.”
pageContext.analysis: A recent Gallup poll found that 90 percent of Republicans approve of Trump's performance. But that doesn't make him the "most popular Republican in history." George W. Bush maintained an approval rating close to 99 percent of Republicans during his first term, for longer than a period of a week. Dwight Eisenhower, with 92 percent, also was higher than Trump.
